comment.author: 31439438@N05
comment._content: Six of the ten companies of this regiment were recruited in Schuylkill County in 1861, with the rest (C, E, G and H) largely coming from Luzerne, Berks, Dauphin, and Montgomery counties. It was assigned to the Sixth Corps of the Army of the Potomac, fought in many battles from Gaines' Mill to Petersburg, and served 3 years until being mustered out in October, 1864.

comment.author: 88134326@N08
comment._content: This photo is adjacent to another copy, and is identified as the "2nd Maine."
